li.The minor is not open to anthropology ma: The minor is not open to anthropology majors.

courseSection0.text: The minor is not open to anthropology majors.

p.The Medical Anthropology minor develops: The Medical Anthropology minor develops students' understanding of health from the perspective of human cultural and biological diversity. Current trends in education and employment show a growing need for medical anthropology knowledge and expertise in a variety of national and international career directions. This Minor therefore prepares students for future graduate studies and work in health professions, including medicine, global health, nursing, and social work.

li.Students must earn a grade of \"C\" (2.0: Students must earn a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
li.At least 15 hours used in the minor must: At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the Anthropology Department.
li.Only two anthropology courses can overla: Only two anthropology courses can overlap for students enrolled in multiple anthropology programs (minors or certificates). (Note: The myKnight Audit cannot capture overlapping courses between two or more programs; therefore, students should have their program reviewed by the department before filing for graduation.)
li.Students must satisfy each course's prer: Students must satisfy each course's prerequisites before enrolling in the class.

courseSection0.text:
The Medical Anthropology minor develops students' understanding of health from the perspective of human cultural and biological diversity. Current trends in education and employment show a growing need for medical anthropology knowledge and expertise in a variety of national and international career directions. This Minor therefore prepares students for future graduate studies and work in health professions, including medicine, global health, nursing, and social work.
Minor Requirements
Students must earn a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in all courses used to satisfy the minor.
At least 15 hours used in the minor must be earned at UCF within the Anthropology Department.
Only two anthropology courses can overlap for students enrolled in multiple anthropology programs (minors or certificates). (Note: The myKnight Audit cannot capture overlapping courses between two or more programs; therefore, students should have their program reviewed by the department before filing for graduation.)
Prerequisite Courses
Students must satisfy each course's prerequisites before enrolling in the class.

courseSection1.text0: ANT3148 - Life and Death in Ancient Egypt (3)
courseSection1.text1: ANT3169 - Life and Death in the Ancient Andes (3)
courseSection1.text3: ANT3290 - Anthropology of Plants and People (3)
courseSection1.text5: ANT3701 - Engagement & Social Change: Public Anthropology (3)
courseSection1.text9: ANT4406 - Pain and Suffering: The Anthropology of Violence (3)
courseSection1.text11: ANT4480 - Global Health in Anthropological Perspective (3)
courseSection1.text12: ANT4481 - Anthropology of Drugs and Addiction (3)
courseSection1.text14: ANT4483 - Health and Healing in the Ancient World: An Anthropological Perspective (3)
courseSection1.text18: ANT4560 - Birth to Death: Anthropological Perspectives on Human Growth (3)

li.Relevant Internship, Research, or Indepe: Relevant Internship, Research, or Independent Study credit can be used to replace one elective course only with prior approval from the minor advisor.
li.One substitution for a Restricted Electi: One substitution for a Restricted Elective Course with another relevant course will be allowed with prior approval from the Medical Anthropology Minor advisor.

courseSection1.text:
Other Requirements

Relevant Internship, Research, or Independent Study credit can be used to replace one elective course only with prior approval from the minor advisor.
One substitution for a Restricted Elective Course with another relevant course will be allowed with prior approval from the Medical Anthropology Minor advisor.
